newsitem.title: GERMANY: Bayer plans Russian research venture.
newsitem.headline: Bayer plans Russian research venture.

text.p: German chemicals and drugs group Bayer AG said on Monday that it planned to cooperate with three research institutes in Russia.
Bayer plans to work with the Shemiakin Institute in Moscow, the Topchiev Institute in Moscow and the Russian Scientific Center for Applied Chemistry in St. Petersburg, the group said in a statement.
Projects will range from researching active ingredients for pharmaceuticals, to organic specialties chemistry and research on materials and process development for polymers, Bayer said.

"The cooperations will open up new prospects for work together on scientific applications projects as well as create market opportunities in the Russian Federation," Bayer chairman Manfred Schneider said in the statement.
For 1996 Bayer said it expects its sales in the CIS to reach over 150 million marks.
